summary: The document is a classified CIA report from 11 August 1964, focusing on Guillermo ARASTAGUIA, a former officer in the Cuban Intelligence Service. It provides a detailed account of his physical appearance, his significant roles within the Cuban intelligence framework, and his connections with notable figures like Ramiro VALDES and Anibal ESCALANTE. Additionally, it covers his involvement in the Youth Festival in Helsinki and his travels to Moscow. The report emphasizes the confidential nature of the information, restricting its distribution to foreign parties without explicit CIA authorization.
key_findings: Guillermo ARASTAGUIA served as a chief in the Department of Technical Operational Support under the Cuban General Directorate of Intelligence (DGI).
His transfer to the DGI was influenced by his ties to Anibal ESCALANTE and allegations regarding his homosexuality.
ARASTAGUIA's participation in the Youth Festival in Helsinki and his three visits to Moscow are documented.
The report includes observations on his physical traits and effeminate behavior.

Earlier reports from 1960 and 1961 reference a Guillermo ARRASTIA or ARRASTIA Fundora, potentially the same individual as ARASTAGUIA, underscoring his intelligence role and close associations with Ramiro VALDES and Raul CASTRO.
